paper_abstract: In 2006, Wang-Li proposed a new user authentication scheme using smart cards which can offer forward secrecy. However, this paper will demonstrate that Wang-Li's scheme is vulnerable to parallel session attack and reflection attack. Furthermore, the current paper presents a more efficient and secure scheme that not only resolves such problems, but also involves fewer computations and communications than Wang-Li's scheme.
paper_title: Enhanced forward-secure user authentication scheme with smart cards
